contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Mary, who gave birth to Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Mary, by whom Jesus was born

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom people call Christ" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who is called Christ

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they realized that she was going to have a baby" or "it happened that she was pregnant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she was found to be pregnant

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Holy Spirit caused Mary to become pregnant with this child" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one who is conceived in her is conceived by the Holy Spirit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what the Lord told the prophet to write long ago" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ ῥηθὲν ὑπὸ Κυρίου διὰ τοῦ προφήτου
contextId.glQuote: what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "this is what the prophet wrote long ago" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: this is what was written by the prophet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the learned men had embarrassed him by tricking him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he had been mocked by the learned men

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "This fulfilled" or "Herod's actions fulfilled" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then was fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what the Lord spoke long ago through the prophet Jeremiah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ ῥηθὲν διὰ Ἰερεμίου τοῦ προφήτου
contextId.glQuote: what had been spoken through Jeremiah the prophet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People heard a voice" or "There was a loud sound" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A voice was heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one could comfort her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she refused to be comforted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what the Lord spoke long ago through the prophets" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what had been spoken through the prophets

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For Isaiah the prophet was speaking of John the Baptist when he said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οὗτος γάρ ἐστιν ὁ ῥηθεὶς διὰ Ἠσαΐου τοῦ προφήτου λέγοντος
contextId.glQuote: For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "John baptized them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were baptized by him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will never burn out" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: can never be put out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so John could baptize him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be baptized by John

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "After John baptized Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: After he was baptized

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jesus saw the sky open" or "God opened the heavens to Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the heavens were opened to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Spirit led Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ Ἰησοῦς ἀνήχθη ... ὑπὸ τοῦ Πνεύματος
contextId.glQuote: Jesus was led up by the Spirit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so the devil could tempt Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be tempted by the devil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses wrote this in the scriptures long ago" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for the writer wrote in the scriptures" or "for it says in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is understood that Jesus is quoting scripture again. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Again, I will tell you what Moses wrote in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: Again it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For Moses also wrote in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the king had arrested John" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: John had been arrested

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what God said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what was said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom demons controlled" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those possessed by demons

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will comfort them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be comforted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will fill them" or "God will satisfy them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be filled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for God will call them his children" or "they will be children of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for they will be called sons of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those people whom others treat unfairly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who have been persecuted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "except for people to throw it out into the road and walk on it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: except to be thrown out and trampled under people's feet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all things have happened" or "God causes all things to happen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all things have been accomplished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if anyone ... teaches others to do so, God will call that person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: whoever ... teaches others to do so will be called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed with an active verb. Alternate translation: "God said to those who lived long ago" or "Moses said to your ancestors long ago" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was said to them in ancient times

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "First make peace with the person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: First be reconciled with your brother

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the officer might put you in prison" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you may be thrown into prison

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that God said" or "that Moses said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that it was said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "than for God to throw your whole body into hell" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: than that your whole body should be thrown into hell

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God also said" or "Moses also said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It was also said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "her after her husband has divorced her" or "the divorced woman" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: her after she has been divorced

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed with an active verb. Alternate translation: "God said to those who lived long ago" or "Moses said to your ancestors long ago" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was said to those in ancient times

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Matthew 5:27](../05/27.md). Alternate translation: "that God God said" or "that Moses said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that it was said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Matthew 5:27](../05/27.md). Alternate translation: "that God God said" or "that Moses said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that it was said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you can give to the poor without other people knowing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ᾖ σου ἡ ἐλεημοσύνη ἐν τῷ κρυπτῷ
contextId.glQuote: your gift may be given in secret

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "their false gods will hear them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May everything on earth happen in accordance with your will as everything in heaven does" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May your will be done on earth as it is in heaven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "did not wear clothes that are as beautiful as these lilies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was not clothed like one of these

contextId.occurrenceNote: The Jews at that time used grass in their fires to cook their food. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone throws it into a fire" or "someone burns it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is thrown into the oven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will provide all these things for you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all these things will be given to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will not condemn you harshly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will not be judged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will condemn you in the same way you condemn others" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: with the judgment you judge, you will be judged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will measure it out to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be measured out to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will give you what you need" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be given to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will open it for you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be opened to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people cut down and burn" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is cut down and thrown into the fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he built it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was built

contextId.occurrenceNote: The result of Jesus saying "Be clean" was that the man was healed. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he was well" or "the leprosy left him" or "the leprosy ended" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was cleansed of his leprosy

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will become well" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "who is under the authority of someone else" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who is placed under authority

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will throw the sons of the kingdom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οἱ δὲ υἱοὶ τῆς βασιλείας ἐκβληθήσονται
contextId.glQuote: the sons of the kingdom will be thrown

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so I will do it for you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so may it be done for you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jesus healed the servant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the servant was healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "many people whom demons possessed" or "many people whom demons controlled" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: many who were possessed by demons

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jesus fulfilled the prophecy that the prophet Isaiah had spoken to the people of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πληρωθῇ τὸ ῥηθὲν διὰ Ἠσαΐου τοῦ προφήτου
contextId.glQuote: was fulfilled that which had been spoken by Isaiah the prophet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a powerful storm arose on the sea" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: σεισμὸς μέγας ἐγένετο ἐν τῇ θαλάσσῃ
contextId.glQuote: there arose a great storm on the sea

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that the waves covered the boat" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὥστε τὸ πλοῖον καλύπτεσθαι ὑπὸ τῶν κυμάτων
contextId.glQuote: so that the boat was covered with the waves

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "two men whom demons possessed" or "two men whom demons were controlling" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: two men who were possessed by demons

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what Jesus did to help the men whom demons had controlled" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what had happened to the men who had been possessed by demons

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that the disciples were with Jesus. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Jesus entered a boat

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have forgiven your sins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your sins have been forgiven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the bridegroom will not be able to be with them any longer" or "someone will take the bridegroom away from them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the bridegroom will be taken away from them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "this will make the tear worse" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a worse tear will be made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and this will ruin the wineskins and spill the wine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ οἶνος ἐκχεῖται καὶ οἱ ἀσκοὶ ἀπόλλυνται
contextId.glQuote: the wine will be spilled, and the wineskins will be destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "this will keep safe both the wineskins and the wine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: both will be preserved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jesus healed her at that moment" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἐσώθη ἡ γυνὴ ἀπὸ τῆς ὥρας ἐκείνης
contextId.glQuote: the woman was healed from that hour

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "After Jesus had sent the crowd outside" or "After the family had sent the people outside" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When the crowd had been put outside

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will do as you have believed" or "Because you believe, I will heal you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: κατὰ τὴν πίστιν ὑμῶν γενηθήτω ὑμῖν
contextId.glQuote: Let it be done to you according to your faith

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone brought a mute man ... to Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a mute man ... was brought to Jesus

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom a demon had possessed" or "whom a demon was controlling" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: possessed by a demon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "After Jesus had forced the demon out" or "After Jesus had commanded the demon to leave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When the demon had been driven out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "This has never happened before" or "No one has ever done anything like this before" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This has never been seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will bring you" or "they will drag you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be brought

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for the Holy Spirit will tell you what to say" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for what to say will be given to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "have them put to death" or "have the authorities execute them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: cause them to be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Everyone will hate you" or "All people will hate you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You will be hated by everyone

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will deliver that person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that person will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God knows even how many hairs are on your head" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: even the hairs of your head are all numbered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I am healing lepers" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: lepers are being cleansed

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here to raise up is an idiom for causing someone who has died to become alive again. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people who have died are being caused to live again" or "I am causing those who have died to become alive again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]]) and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the dead are being raised back to life

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I am preaching good news to the poor" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the gospel is being preached to the poor

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "swaying in the wind" or "blowing in the wind" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: being shaken by the wind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "This is what the prophet Malachi wrote long ago about John the Baptist" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This is he of whom it was written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "in which he did most of his mighty deeds" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἐν αἷς ἐγένοντο αἱ πλεῖσται δυνάμεις αὐτοῦ
contextId.glQuote: in which most of his mighty deeds were done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated with active forms. Alternate translation: "If I had done the mighty deeds among the people of Tyre and Sidon that I have done among you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: εἰ ἐν Τύρῳ καὶ Σιδῶνι ἐγένοντο αἱ δυνάμεις αἱ γενόμεναι ἐν ὑμῖν
contextId.glQuote: If the mighty deeds had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will send you down to Hades" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be brought down to Hades

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if I had done the mighty deeds among the people of Sodom that I have done among you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: εἰ ἐν Σοδόμοις ἐγενήθησαν αἱ δυνάμεις αἱ γενόμεναι ἐν σοί
contextId.glQuote: if in Sodom there had been done the mighty deeds that were done in you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "My Father has entrusted all things to me" or "My Father has given everything over to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All things have been entrusted to me from my Father

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it was healthy again" or "it became well again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was restored to health

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then someone brought to Jesus a man who was blind and mute because a demon was controlling him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then someone blind and mute, possessed by a demon, was brought to Jesus

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will forgive every sin that people commit and every evil thing they say" or "God will forgive every person who sins or says evil things" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πᾶσα ἁμαρτία καὶ βλασφημία ἀφεθήσεται τοῖς ἀνθρώποις
contextId.glQuote: every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will not forgive the person who speaks evil things about the Holy Spirit" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἡ δὲ τοῦ Πνεύματος, βλασφημία οὐκ ἀφεθήσεται
contextId.glQuote: blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will forgive a person for that" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that will be forgiven him

contextId.occurrenceNote: "Fruit" here is a metaphor for what a person does. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people know whether a tree is good or bad by looking at its fruit" or "people know whether a person is good or bad by looking at the results of that person's activities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: a tree is recognized by its fruit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will justify you ... God will condemn you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be justified ... you will be condemned

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus would not give them a sign because, though he had already performed many miracles, they refused to believe him. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will not give it a sign" or "God will not give you a sign" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: no sign will be given to it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the unclean spirit finds that someone has swept the house clean and has put everything in the house where it belongs" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it finds that house swept out and put in order

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the sun scorched the plants, and they became too hot" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were scorched

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated with the active form and with implied information expressed clearly. Alternate translation: "God has given you the privilege of understanding mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but God has not given it to these people" or "God has made you able to understand mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but he has not enabled these people to understand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: You have been given the privilege of understanding mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will give him more understanding" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be given more

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will take away even what he has" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: καὶ ... ὃ ἔχει ἀρθήσεται ἀπ’ αὐτοῦ
contextId.glQuote: even what he has will be taken away from him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form: Alternate translation: "the message that God sowed in his heart" or "the message that he heard" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ ἐσπαρμένον ἐν τῇ καρδίᾳ αὐτοῦ
contextId.glQuote: what has been sown in his heart

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what God told one of the prophets to write long ago might come true" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πληρωθῇ τὸ ῥηθὲν διὰ τοῦ προφήτου λέγοντος
contextId.glQuote: what had been said through the prophet might come true, when he said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "things that God has kept hidden" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: things that were hidden

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Therefore, as people gather up weeds and burn them in the fire" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὥσπερ οὖν συλλέγεται τὰ ζιζάνια καὶ πυρὶ κατακαίεται
contextId.glQuote: Therefore, as the weeds are gathered up and burned with fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a treasure that someone had hidden in a field" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁμοία ἐστὶν ... θησαυρῷ κεκρυμμένῳ ἐν τῷ ἀγρῷ
contextId.glQuote: like a treasure hidden in a field

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "like a net that some fishermen cast into the sea" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: like a net that was cast into the sea

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The people of Jesus' hometown took offense at him" or "The people rejected Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were offended by him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "After her mother instructed her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: After being instructed by her mother

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Her request made the king very upset" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The king was very upset by her request

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he ordered his men to do what she said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he ordered that it should be done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἠνέχθη ἡ κεφαλὴ αὐτοῦ ἐπὶ πίνακι, καὶ ἐδόθη τῷ κορασίῳ
contextId.glQuote: his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "until they were full" or "until they were no longer hungry" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: and were filled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "became well" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: were healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "this statement made the Pharisees angry" or "this statement offended the Pharisees" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the Pharisees were offended when they heard this statement

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "my Father will uproot" or "he will take out of the ground" or "he will remove" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be rooted up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "A demon is controlling my daughter terribly" or "A demon is tormenting my daughter severely" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: My daughter is severely demon-possessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God did not send me to anyone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I was not sent to anyone

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let it be done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jesus healed her daughter" or "Her daughter became well" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Her daughter was healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the crippled become well" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the crippled made well

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus would not give them a sign because, though he had already performed many miracles, they refused to believe him. This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [Matthew 12:39](../12/39.md). Alternate translation: "I will not give it a sign" or "God will not give you a sign" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: no sign will be given to it

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here to raise back to life is an idiom for causing someone who has died to become alive again. This can be stated in active form. The elders and chief priests would accuse Jesus so that others would kill him. Alternate translation: "scribes. People will then kill him , and on the third day God will make him become alive again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: scribes, be killed, and be raised back to life on the third day

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "his appearance had changed" or "he appeared very different" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He was transfigured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the boy became well" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the boy was healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone will deliver the Son of Man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The Son of Man will be delivered

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here to raise up is an idiom for causing someone who has died to become alive again. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will raise him up" or "God will cause him to become alive again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be raised up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if someone put a great millstone around his neck and threw him into the deep sea" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a great millstone should be hung about his neck, and that he should be sunk into the depths of the sea

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "than to have both hands and feet when God throws you into the eternal fire" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἢ ... δύο χεῖρας ἢ δύο πόδας ἔχοντα, βληθῆναι εἰς τὸ πῦρ τὸ αἰώνιον
contextId.glQuote: than to be thrown into the eternal fire having two hands or two feet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "than to have both eyes when God throws you into the eternal fire" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: than to be thrown into the eternal fire having both eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone brought one of the king's servant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: one servant was brought

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the king commanded his servants to sell the man ... and to pay the debt with the money from the sale" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his master commanded him to be sold ... and payment to be made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the first servant owed the king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was owed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom God allows" or "whom God enables" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who are allowed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "there are men whom other men have made eunuchs" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: εἰσὶν ... εὐνοῦχοι, οἵτινες ... εὐνουχίσθησαν ὑπὸ τῶν ἀνθρώπων
contextId.glQuote: there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "some people brought little children to Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: some little children were brought to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the landowner hired" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who had been hired

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone will deliver the Son of Man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the Son of Man will be delivered

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "be raised up" are an idiom for "be made alive again." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will raise him up" or "God will make him alive again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be raised up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "my Father has prepared those places, and he will give them to whom he chooses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it is for those for whom it has been prepared by my Father

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "did not come so that other people would serve him" or "did not come so that other people would serve me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: did not come to be served

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can state this in active form. Alternate translation: "a donkey that someone has tied up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a donkey tied up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "this happened so that Jesus would fulfill what God spoke through the prophet long ago" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τοῦτο δὲ γέγονεν, ἵνα πληρωθῇ τὸ ῥηθὲν διὰ τοῦ προφήτου
contextId.glQuote: this came about that what was spoken through the prophet might be fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The prophets wrote long ago" or "God said long ago" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "My house will be" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: My house will be called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it will happen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "has become the cornerstone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: has been made the cornerstone

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the people the king had invited" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who had been invited

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom I invited" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who were invited

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So the guests filled the wedding hall" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So the wedding hall was filled with guests

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For God invites many people, but he only chooses a few" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For many people are called, but few are chosen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "nor will people give their children in marriage" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: nor are given in marriage

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what God spoke to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ ῥηθὲν ὑμῖν ὑπὸ τοῦ Θεοῦ
contextId.glQuote: what was spoken to you by God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They do all their deeds so that people can see what they do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πάντα ... τὰ ἔργα αὐτῶν, ποιοῦσιν πρὸς τὸ θεαθῆναι τοῖς ἀνθρώποις
contextId.glQuote: They do all their deeds to be seen by people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for people to call them 'Rabbi.'" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be called 'Rabbi' by people.

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But you must not let anyone call you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But you must not be called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Also, do not let anyone call you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Neither must you be called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will humble" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be humbled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will make important" or "God will honor" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be exalted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom God sends to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who are sent to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Do not let these things trouble you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: See that you are not troubled

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "nations" is a metonym, referring to the people of nations. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People from every nation will hate you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.quote: ἔσεσθε μισούμενοι ὑπὸ πάντων τῶν ἐθνῶν
contextId.glQuote: You will be hated by all the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will save the person who endures to the end" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ δὲ ὑπομείνας εἰς τέλος ... σωθήσεται
contextId.glQuote: the one who endures to the end will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the shameful one who defiles the things of God, about whom Daniel the prophet wrote" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ‘ βδέλυγμα τῆς ἐρημώσεως’, τὸ ῥηθὲν διὰ Δανιὴλ τοῦ προφήτου
contextId.glQuote: the abomination of desolation, which was spoken of by Daniel the prophet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will shorten the time of suffering" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those days will be shortened

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will make the sun dark" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the sun will be darkened

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will shake things in the sky and above the sky" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the powers of the heavens will be shaken

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) the Son of Man will take one away to heaven and will leave the other on earth for punishment or 2) the angels will take one away for punishment and leave the other for blessing. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: one will be taken, and one will be left

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "would not have allowed anyone to get into his house to steal things" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οὐκ ἂν εἴασεν διορυχθῆναι τὴν οἰκίαν αὐτοῦ
contextId.glQuote: would not have allowed his house to be broken into

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "My master is slow to return" or "My master will not return for a long time" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: My master has been delayed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "while the bridegroom was taking a long time to arrive" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: while the bridegroom was delayed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the servants shut the door" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the door was shut

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will take away" or "I will take away" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be taken away

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He will gather all the nations before him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: συναχθήσονται ἔμπροσθεν αὐτοῦ πάντα τὰ ἔθνη
contextId.glQuote: Before him will be gathered all the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Come, you whom my Father has blessed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: δεῦτε‘ οἱ εὐλογημένοι τοῦ Πατρός μου
contextId.glQuote: Come, you who have been blessed by my Father

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "inherit the kingdom that God has made ready for you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: inherit the kingdom prepared for you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the eternal fire that God has prepared" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the eternal fire that has been prepared

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "some men will take the Son of Man to other people who will crucify him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ Υἱὸς τοῦ Ἀνθρώπου παραδίδοται εἰς τὸ σταυρωθῆναι
contextId.glQuote: the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "came together" or "met together" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: were gathered together

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "She could have sold this for a large amount of money and given the money" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This could have been sold for a large amount and given

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "wherever people preach this good news" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὅπου ἐὰν κηρυχθῇ τὸ εὐαγγέλιον τοῦτο
contextId.glQuote: wherever this good news is preached

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will remember what this woman has done and will tell others about her" or "people will remember what this woman has done and will tell others about her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what this woman has done will also be spoken of in memory of her

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "just as the prophets wrote about him in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: just as it is written about him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the man who betrays the Son of Man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τῷ ἀνθρώπῳ ἐκείνῳ δι’ οὗ ὁ Υἱὸς τοῦ Ἀνθρώπου παραδίδοται
contextId.glQuote: that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will soon flow out of my body" or "will flow out of my wounds when I die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is poured out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for the prophet Zechariah wrote long ago in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will scatter all the sheep of the flock" or "the sheep of the flock will run off in all directions" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the sheep of the flock will be scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here to raise up is an idiom for causing someone who has died to become alive again. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "after God raises me up" or "after God brings me back to life" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: after I am raised up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "may what you want happen" or "do what you want to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your will be done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone is betraying the Son of Man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the Son of Man is being betrayed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I would fulfill all that the prophets wrote in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the writings of the prophets might be fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the Jewish leaders had condemned Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that Jesus had been condemned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people call that field" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that field has been called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "This fulfilled what the prophet Jeremiah spoke" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τότε ἐπληρώθη τὸ ῥηθὲν διὰ Ἰερεμίου τοῦ προφήτου
contextId.glQuote: Then that which had been spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the price the people of Israel set on him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the price set on him by the people of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But when the chief priests and elders accused him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But when he was accused by the chief priests and elders

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "prisoner whom the crowd would choose" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: prisoner chosen by the crowd

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the crowd gathered" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were gathered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom some people call the Christ" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Jesus who is called Christ

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "have the Roman soldiers kill Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: have Jesus killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom some people call the Christ" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who is called Christ

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "place that people called Golgotha" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: place called Golgotha

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "him wine, which they had mixed with gall" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: αὐτῷ πιεῖν οἶνον μετὰ χολῆς μεμιγμένον
contextId.glQuote: him wine to drink mixed with gall

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The soldiers crucified two robbers with Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Two robbers were crucified with him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the robbers that the soldiers crucified with Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οἱ λῃσταὶ, οἱ συνσταυρωθέντες σὺν αὐτῷ
contextId.glQuote: the robbers who were crucified with him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the curtain of the temple tore in two" or "God caused the curtain of the temple to tear in two" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ καταπέτασμα τοῦ ναοῦ ἐσχίσθη εἰς δύο
contextId.glQuote: the curtain of the temple was split in two

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God opened the tombs and raised the bodies of many godly people who had died" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The tombs were opened, and the bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then Pilate ordered the soldiers to give the body of Jesus to Joseph" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then Pilate ordered it to be given to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "command your soldiers to guard the tomb" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: command that the tomb be made secure

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the people and the soldiers crucified" or "whom they crucified" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who has been crucified

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "did what the priests had told them to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: did as they had been instructed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "My Father has given me all authority" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All authority has been given to me
